title: Euro dips, Europe stocks rise after Draghi comments
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Sep 3, 2015, 15:20 BST - UK Markets close in 1 hr 10 mins Euro dips, Europe stocks rise after Draghi comments Reuters - UK Focus – 1 hour 23 minutes ago Print 
LONDON, Sept 3 (Reuters) - The euro weakened against the dollar, European stocks rose and yields on bonds fell on Thursday after ECB chief Mario Draghi cut growth and inflation forecasts and said the central bank could buy a greater share of individual bonds under its asset-purchase programme. 
The euro dropped to a two-week low of $1.1155 after Draghi flagged downside risks to euro zone growth. The FTSEurofirst 300 rose and was last up 2.0 percent on the day. 
German bund futures hit the day's high and were last up 70 ticks on the day at 153.84. Yields on benchmark 10-year German bonds, which the ECB has been buying under its quantitative easing programme, were down 4 basis points at 0.75 percent, with other euro zone equivalents down 2-8 bps. (Reporting by London markets team, writing by Nigel Stephenson; Editing by John Geddie) Follow the quotes you care about most.
